page.title: 12HOUSING:ASHLEWORTH
page.content: Some of Ashleworth's houses are situated pleasantly round the Village Green.They are a variety of detached homes,mostly built of brick,with one timber-framed cottage and the {school} dating from 1842.The Court,c.1460, built of limestone,originally had a thatched roof.It is practically unspoiled,has a handsome doorway and traceried windows.Ashleworth{Manor,} c.1460 is one of Gloucetershire's loveliest timbered houses,with an overhanging storey,gables and tall chimneys.It is shaped like an E,the middle of the letter a storeyed porch. Goodrich Orchard is a modern estate of 8 luxury detached homes,completed this year.{Council estates}include 12 old people's bungalows and 18 houses.The remaining houses in Ashleworth and Hasfield include farm cottages,modern detached homes and some bungalows.
